column21: FYI – the ERC is basically waived after 60 days (3+ yr loan) and 30 days for 2yr loan. Agreed  Even during the extension.  This is fine – you only really extend when a small delay in exit, and it’s at full interest rate so can be penal compared to a 3yr (to avoid gaming).  We will also have retention products then to try to lock them in again
column22: 2yr:  24+up to 3m servicer permitted extension. During the extension, interest is due at the FULL interest rate, not the pay rate serviceable on full IR, however ZBL allows extension upto 12months

column13: QUESTION: is the max individual loan on PBL £3m, TBD , await lender confirmation  like it is on ZBL? ZBL specifically calls it out, but PBL just has standard ‘£4m’ for single property loan there will be some covenant set by PBL Lender which we are finalising terms on max amount
column21: ·      An early repayment charge (ERC) is payable if the Borrower redeems the loan before the contractual maturity date of the loan.  ERC is waived for any early redemptions that occur within a grace period starting from a maximum of 60 days prior to the original contractual maturity date and continuing thereafter (including during any Servicer Extension).  Does this cover if redeemed on month 22?
column22: 3yr: 24+up to 12m servicer permitted extension. We grant this automatically subject to conditions.  Whilst the contract states interest due at full rate, we’ve done the upfront calculations that the deferred interest/net loan means reduced payments to not impact LTV adversely , pls discuss as currently UW are deferring interest upto 36m by issuing 24m term +12m (extension ), hence the issue we had today, with this the serviceable interest from 24m to 36m become serviceable  on pay rate, 4.79%  rate deferred 0.50%  for 36m with 2 month rolled up , the borrow is serving interest on deferred rate for 34m at 4.29% -
